main

Class VNSound

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.VNSound

  • public class VNSound
extends java.lang.Object
    Play sounds with this VNSound tool. When initialized, will not loop. Sounds start off at 0 decibels/93 percent volume
    Author:
    Bradley

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VNSound()
      A constructor for those who dont want open any sound and just have a VNSound tool nearby to use.
      VNSound(java.io.File file)
      Constructor that starts off the VNSound tool with a sound.
      VNSound(java.io.File file, float volume)
      Constructor that starts off the VNSound tool with a sound at a certain volume.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VNSound

        public VNSound(java.io.File file)
        Constructor that starts off the VNSound tool with a sound. Will not loop
        Parameters:
        file - - the file path and name of the audio to play

      • VNSound

        public VNSound(java.io.File file,
               float volume)
        Constructor that starts off the VNSound tool with a sound at a certain volume. Will not loop.
        Parameters:
        file - - the file path and name of the audio to play
        volume - - volume to play the file at

      • VNSound

        public VNSound()
        A constructor for those who dont want open any sound and just have a VNSound tool nearby to use.

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public void open(java.io.File file)
        Opens a new sound and replaces the old one. If object is set to loop the sound (isLoop = true) then it will loop
        Parameters:
        file - - the file path and name of the audio to play

      • open

        public void open(java.io.File file,
                 float volume)
        Will open a new file for a certain volume.
        Parameters:
        file - - File of audio to open
        volume - - Volume of audio to play from 100 to 0

      • play

        public void play()
        Starts playing the sound

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops playing the sound

      • setLoop

        public void setLoop(boolean loop)
        Sets isLoop to input TODO clean up loop business
        Parameters:
        loop - - true will loop false will not

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(float volume)
        Will set volume to the volume inputed. If volume input is greater than 100 or less than 0 then then the respective maximum or minimum volume will be input instead.
        Parameters:
        volume - - volume to have audio at, from 0 to 100

      • getVolume

        public float getVolume()
        Gives the volume of the VNSound in percent
        Returns:
        Current volume of VNSound

      • getLoop

        public boolean getLoop()
        Return isLoop
        Returns:
        isLoop, true if is looping false if not
